definition: from start to finish/from head to tail/the whole (thing)
surname Cong

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc

sentences.english: You don't need to start with Chapter 1 and read it cover to cover.
sentences.chinese: 您不必与第1章开始和读取它从头到尾。

sentences.english: She can recite the long poem from the beginning to the end.
sentences.chinese: 她能把那首长诗从头到尾地背下来。

sentences.english: To my amazement, he was able to recite the poem from memory.
sentences.chinese: 令我大为惊奇的是，他把这首诗从头到尾背了出来。

sentences.english: Likewise, Sussman reads his newsweekly cover-to-cover every week.
sentences.chinese: 苏斯曼同样是每周都从头到尾地阅读新闻周刊。

sentences.english: I read the entire book on the flight back to Connecticut.
sentences.chinese: 在回康涅狄格的飞机上，我从头到尾看完了这本书。

sentences.english: The whole pattern from the beginning.
The FA also noted that at no time did Wenger mention Foy by name.
sentences.chinese: 足总同时指出从头到尾，温格都没提过福伊的名字。

sentences.english: From start to finish the movie took two years to film.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影从头到尾共花了两年才完成。

sentences.english: I thought the whole thing was first-rate from beginning to end.
sentences.chinese: 我认为全部表演从头到尾都是一琉的。

sentences.english: The pier was lit up along its entire length.
sentences.chinese: 整个桥墩从头到尾都沐浴在灯火之中。

sentences.english: It's best to write it all out--start to finish--and then go back and figure out what needs tweaking.
sentences.chinese: 最好是先从头到尾写出来，然后再从头开始修改。

sentences.english: Want to carry her completely while she goes from beginning to end?Your choice.
sentences.chinese: 想从头到尾都举着她是你的选择。

sentences.english: I've read the book twice from cover to cover.
sentences.chinese: 这本书我从头到尾看过两遍。

sentences.english: I'll teach you from Bto Z.
See a 69 at the end, and you’re guaranteed to roll your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 从头到尾都是6和9，我保证你会翻白眼。

sentences.english: I just like the sky star, from beginning to end is a supporting role, background.
sentences.chinese: 我就像满天星，从头到尾都是配角，背景。

definition: from start to finish (idiom)
one time (all the way through)/once through
anew/from the start
always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
conscientious/earnest/serious/to take seriously/to take to heart
careful/attentive/cautious
completely
to repeat (one's own words or sb else's)/(in the classroom) to paraphrase what one has learned
variant of 複述|复述[fu4 shu4]
from the start/absolutely/entirely/simply
to sketch in light shades/to play down/to deemphasize (idiom)
all/without exception
honestly speaking/to be frank, ...
to relate (a story or information)/to tell or talk about/to recount/narration/telling/narrative/account
over and over
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
only/just (i.e. it is only that...)/all except/unique
